intro: Phyllanthus brassii, commonly known as the African date palm, is a flowering plant native to Africa. It is a member of the Euphorbiaceae family and is characterized by its tall, slender trunk and large, pinnately compound leaves. The plant produces small, greenish-yellow flowers that are clustered in inflorescences. Its fruits are fleshy, yellow berries that contain a single seed. Phyllanthus brassii is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is also used in traditional medicine.
